security: This oral history transcript does not contain sensitive information that requires a detailed security assessment.
summary: This is a transcript of an oral history interview with Edward G. Lansdale conducted on July 11, 1970, by Dennis J. O'Brien for the John F. Kennedy Library, focusing on Lansdale's involvement with Vietnam and the Bay of Pigs invasion.
summary_one_paragraph: On July 11, 1970, Dennis J. O'Brien interviewed Edward G. Lansdale in Alexandria, Virginia, for the John F. Kennedy Library, during which they discussed Lansdale's first meeting with President Kennedy, his views on the planning of the Bay of Pigs invasion, and his interactions with figures like Allen Dulles, Richard Bissell, and Robert Kennedy. Lansdale shared his reservations about the military invasion approach taken by the CIA and his subsequent disassociation from the project, as well as his assessment of the emotional impact the Bay of Pigs failure had on key executives in the Kennedy administration.
title: ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEW WITH EDWARD G. LANSDALE
